subject: Critical Thinking
title: The Framing Effect: Same Facts, Different Decisions
description: A quick win: understand The Framing Effect: Same Facts, Different Decisions.

hook.text: 'This yogurt is 90% fat-free' or 'This yogurt contains 10% fat.' Same yogurt. Completely different sales.

buildup.text: The framing effect: how information is presented changes decisions â€” even when the underlying facts are identical.

discovery.text: Tversky & Kahneman: '200 of 600 people saved' vs.

twist.text: Gain frames make people conservative. Loss frames make people reckless. Marketers and politicians know this.

climax.text: The antidote: reframe every major decision both ways. If your choice changes, the framing was doing the thinking.

punchline.text: The frame isn't the picture. Don't let it choose for you.

quiz.question: What does the framing effect demonstrate?
options: How information is presented changes decisions even with identical facts
